title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 April 2009 - XWiki
content:
cypromis left at 00:01 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
vmassol left at 00:02 ()  
florinciu left at 00:06 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 00:09  
tharindu - (29/04/2009 00:19): sdumitriu: Hi, how can I edit a blog post in other mode Inline form? It will redirect to WYSIWYG editor  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:20): I don't understand  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:20): What's wrong?  
tharindu - (29/04/2009 00:24): I mean when I try to edit a blog post it will go to WYSIWG editor  
tharindu - (29/04/2009 00:24): but I want to edit the syntax of the post like wiki mode in a normal page  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:25): OK  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:26): Go to your profile  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:26): Switch to advanced mode  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:26): Edit your profile in the object editor  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:27): Edit the XWiki.XWikiUsers object  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 00:27): And change the Default Editor property to Text  
tharindu - (29/04/2009 00:28): sdumitriu: Thanks, It just solved it great :)

asyd - (29/04/2009 08:39): what about you

asyd - (29/04/2009 08:42): will you on holidays?

marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:46): jvelociter: good morning  
jvelociter - (29/04/2009 09:46): salut marta\_   
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:48): i wanted to install the workstream on gsoc.myxwiki, but for some reason it's not working, not making the updates  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:48): do you have any idea why this might happen?  
jvelociter - (29/04/2009 09:50): do we have the activity stream plugin installed on myxwiki ?  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:51): uhm, good question, i just saw the warning on the app page :)  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:51): (i hadn't noticed it before)  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 09:53): ok, so that must be it, thanks  
jvelociter - (29/04/2009 09:59): marta\_: if you install it, make sure you mark it on the upgrade notes or it will be dropped next upgrade  
jvelociter - (29/04/2009 10:00): (even if marked, you may lose it I think )  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 10:00): ok

sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 13:37): alexmaru and cristinaS: You should create your wiki profiles  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:42): sdumitriu: ok , sure I will do it today  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:43): these days I read more about open office api ..   
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:45): I was not happy about how I did that small extension .. I had to set all the dialog properties from java in string mode something like setProperty("text", "my value") .. and now I've discoved that I can do this easierier using basic macros  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:46): and this basic macros can ne accesed from the java pat of the component  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:46): it's ok if I use so?  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 13:46): What kind of macros?  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:46): open office basic macros  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:47): these macros camn be exported in libraries  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:47): and the events can be treated from java  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:47): in the component  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:48): in this way forms can be created using the dialog editor which is visual  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:48): and is much easier  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 13:49): You should put such discoveries in a blog post on the wiki  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 13:49): (quick question: does this site work for you https://socialsite.dev.java.net/ ?)  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:50): http://wiki.services.openoffice.org/wiki/Documentation/DevGuide/WritingUNO/Using\_Dialogs\_in\_Components  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:50): ok , sure  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 13:50): I will put in my blog  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 13:56): anamarias: https://socialsite.dev.java.net/ works for me  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 13:57): weird, for me it doesn't . yesterday it didn't either  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 13:59): maybe it's location based, for Cristina doesn't work either. I'll try from somewhere else when i get the chance  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:00): You can use a proxy  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:01): There are several web-based ones  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 14:01): can you recommend one ? i didn't use one for this purpose before  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:05): I don't remember either  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 14:07): no probl, i'll look for one  
anamarias - (29/04/2009 14:20): I think the Panel with Create new Page/Space on myxwiki has disappeared   
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 14:21): yes, at me too  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:21): Yes  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:21): You needed that?  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 14:21): I was trying to create a new space for XOO  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:21): Use the dashboard on the main page  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 14:21): ok  
cristinaS - (29/04/2009 14:21): I will add my blog in that space?  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:21): marta\_: You removed it  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:22): cristinaS: Yes  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 14:22): i removed what?  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:23): The Create panel  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 14:23): ah, the panel  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:23): cristinaS: http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improving+the+setup+and+upgrade+process/Introduction  
marta\_ - (29/04/2009 14:23): i'll put it back  
florinciu - (29/04/2009 14:26): sdumitriu: I get "You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action." on gsoc.myxwiki.org when authenticated  
sdumitriu - (29/04/2009 14:27): Are you using a global account?  
florinciu - (29/04/2009 14:27): yes
